posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
NwnwhiteBoy wrote:So Illusionist is Wizard with illusion Spell area selected?
No.

Spell school

An illusionist is a wizard specializing in the school of illusion: this implies a bonus to spellcraft checks to identify spells from the illusion school, a malus to same checks to identify spells from the opposing school (enchantment), the impossibility to cast/learn/memorize spells (also from scrolls) of the opposing school and +1 spell/spell level chosen from any spell in the spellbook. Apart the spellcraft bonus it has nothing to do with illusion spells, as you can see. Illusion is typically chosen because it is opposed by enchantment which is by many considered expendable, at least is certain circumstances.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
This build is horrible IMO because Cleric there does ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! The only way you will see how bad it is is by comparing it with the one suggested by Grim and with the alterations I suggested. You have to understand certain things first, which is exactly why I said it's best to leave this class combo for later and start with something simpler. Here is the catch: At a level 30 cap, you DON'T HAVE ENOUGH LEVELS to get what is best of this class combo, which basically is full clerical goodies and all arcane spells, plus EMA (Epic Mage Armor) and EW (Epic Warding). Epic Warding requires 34 Spellcraft, so it's simply UNATTAINABLE in Arelith unless it's been modified, as you'd have to be lvl 31 to have 34 ranks in spellcraft. So the lvl 30 caps makes it so that you have to choose between Cleric power and Wizard power. If you, as you did in your original build, go for all wizard spells, Cleric becomes practically useless except for DP, and your pre-epic BAB is so much lower (because you're forced to take many levels of Wizard pre-epic and even waste the Wizard 5 bonus feat in something other than Great Intelligence). All your pre-epic BAB shortage will be "temporarily replaced" by Divine Power, but seriously, you'll have 3 extended DPs a day for 14 rounds, and the rest of the time you just won't hit anything. Compare that to a lvl 15 Cleric with 16 WIsdom that will have 6 to 8 Extended Divine Powers that last for 30 rounds and 4-6 regular Divine Powers that last for 15 rounds, and on top of that, an even higher number of Divine Favors that give +5 to AB and damage as opposed to your build's +2. Your Magic Vestment gives you +2 Armor AC, where the 15 Cleric version would give +5. Are you beginning to see how bad it is?

If you go the other way, like in the build Grim proposed, you won't have access to some of the Wizard's best spells, like Time Stop, Bigby Hands, Modenkainen's Disjunction, Premonition, Shadow Shield, etc. You won't get any epic spells, you won't be able to empower IGMS or extend Mestil's Acid Sheath (you will only have 2 slots of lvl 6 spells so you can extend it but then you won't have IGMS or Bigby lvl 6). So either way you don't get the best of both worlds. I suggest you leave this combo alone if you're going to play on a lvl 30 cap, but if you move somewhere with a lvl 40 cap, it's a whole new world!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane

You end up being a level 40 character that has the spells of level 20 characters (in this case), and it never really gets to be epic. It was better, but still fell short, imo. iirc, i even used 23 cleric levels (divine levels) cuz in PRC you get access to ALL epic spells with ANY caster class.
I'm sorry, but you're wrong about this. VERY wrong. It's pretty common knowledge that you should use only NO-SAVE spells on a low ability caster. Now you saying that you have the same spells as a lvl 20 caster leads me to believe you're not using the correct spells. What you say is right, you do have the same spells or casting prowess of a lvl 20 caster, but it's AWESOME, not bad!!! With most of the useful spells, the difference between the effects of dedicated casters vs this build is minimal or ZERO, except for lvl 9 Cleric spells and a few others, like Blade Barrier. Here's a rough list:

- Time Stop: Same with any caster level.

- Mord's: The Breach effect ALWAYS works regardless of level, the Dispelling one is good against any non-dedicated caster / self buffer (low-mid caster levels).

- Bigby Hands: Only duration is worse, all the other features work exactly the same (in default NWN, as I understand in this case specifically, the server has modified them)

- Premonition: Will absorb a total of 230 points of damage (10 per caster lvl), instead of 300 (capped).

- Spell Mantle line: Pretty much only duration varies

- Shadow Shield: Only duration varies.

- IGMS: Exactly the same.

- Mestil's Acid Sheath: loses up to 34 points of damage (2 per caster level and doesn't cap)

- Improved Invisibility: Only duration varies.

- All stat buffs: The same (Wizards also get access to Cat's Grace without requiring a domain to boost DEX)

- Magic Missile: Same

Now on the Cleric side:

- Lvl 9 Cleric spells: Not very useful, as they all allow a save to be made. In some situations, Implosion or SoV MIGHT work, but not often enough that you can rely on them.

- Word of Faith: Works the same

- Blade Barrier: Loses DC (but you can keep a target immobile by throwing a Bigby 9 at him and watch him die with your Blade Barriers having to roll the saves every single round, which will in part make up for the lower saves with more rolls)

- Harm: Works the same (even better with True Strike in case you get dispelled, as an instant back-up +20 to AB getaway clause, and you can finish off the guy with Magic Missile after a successful Harm)

- All Cleric buffs: same, except Battletide, which will have a lower DC.

Now as for the Monk part of it, here's what you may not be realizing: I think Monk isn't the problem, I think trying to make a Strength build is the problem. Making a Dex-based Wizard / Cleric / Monk you don't need Auto-still feats, your AC will be higher than any full-plate counterpart and so will your INITIATIVE, which means your Time Stop will be the first one to work. That is usually enough for you to kill any single opponent at any given time.

The "weakness" of a build like this only shows if you try to use SoV's, Fire Storms, Wails of the Banshee and such spells. This class combo REALLY has a spell for every situation as long as you follow the guideline of staying away from save spells. Going Hierophant wouldn't work, as even with +10 to DCs, they'll be low most of the time.

In short, as long as you try to stay away from save spells and use metamagic feats to make sure you have many no-save spells at your disposal, this combo is a MONSTER.
